resources.string: This is for Advanced Users.\n\nAdjusting these options may completely change how %1$s performs, proceed at your own risk. Many users will NOT need to change these settings.

This is for Advanced Users.

You can adjust the performance and resource usage of the %1$s Hotspot, which will adjust the number of virtual threads allocated to the Hotspot Network.

More Threads will result in usually faster performance, but higher battery usage and may heat up or slow down your device. 

This option has been deprecated and will be removed in the next release. It caused unpredictable behavior in some situations and was largely made obsolete by new, more efficient code.
Unlimited threads. Offers maximum performance. Throws battery usage concerns out the window.
%1$d threads. Uses the least battery but offers the slowest hotspot performance.
%1$d threads. Uses less battery but offers slower hotspot performance.
%1$d threads. Offers a balance between battery usage and hotspot performance.
%1$d threads. Offers better hotspot performance at the cost of more battery usage.
%1$d threads. Offers great hotspot performance at the cost of significant battery usage.
Change how %1$s creates a Hotspot connection
Using Wi-Fi direct, create a mobile hotspot for multiple devices to connect to. \n\nThis relies on your device\'s ability to successfully use Wi-Fi Direct, which may not be supported on all devices.

Using USB Tethering (RNDIS), create a connection for a single device via USB cable. \n\nThis relies on your device\'s ability to successfully use USB Tethering, which may not be supported on all devices.
Change which connect type %1$s uses for Hotspot communication
Connections to the Hotspot will go over the device\'s active connection.
Connections to the Hotspot will go over Wi-Fi connection if available
Connections to the Hotspot will go over Cellular Data connection if available
